findings.title: Transaction Validation (Signature)
findings.description: Transaction signature validation was not correct, allowing transactions with forged addresses to be executed.

findings.title: No Gas calculation for Contract Opcodes
findings.description: There was no execution fee for running smart contracts on Phantasma node, making it vulnerable to DoS attacks by running a function with an infinite while loop.

findings.title: Tomb Compiler Issue
findings.description: Redesign parser of `TOMB` compiler to throw compile error when user wants to use reserved keywords in invalid statements.

findings.title: Low Code Test Coverage
findings.description: There was a lack of unit tests and low tests code coverage.

findings.title: VirtualMachine Unit Tests
findings.description: There was a lack of unit tests for VirtualMachine.

findings.title: Hardcoded gas limit
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Ignoring Gas Target
findings.description: Null gas target was ignored. The `VMException` was initialized but never thrown. This could cause executing the rest of the method and ignoring `null GasTarget`.

findings.title: Lack Of Documentation
findings.description: There was a lack of unit tests.

findings.title: Runtime Random Number Generator
findings.description: The GenerateRandomNumber() function uses a predictable randomness source, which can lead to a possible attack vector with predicting randomness.

findings.title: No Compatible Wallet (Ecto)
findings.description: Ecto Wallet advertised on Phantasma site was not compatible with the Phantasma node.

findings.title: Always Null Variables
findings.description: Some variables were always null. A reference to null should never be dereferenced/accessed. Doing so will cause a NullReferenceException to be thrown.

findings.title: Execution Frame Unit Tests
findings.description: There was a lack of unit tests for critical functionality in ExecutionFrame.

findings.title: IDisposableObject May Not Disposed
findings.description: Exception during execution of `stop` method could lead to resources leak.

findings.title: Operation On Floating Point Values
findings.description: Operations on floating point values could yield unexpected result.

findings.title: Runtime Values ranges limits assert
findings.description: All external input values should have been defensively validated against ranges / lengths / sizes

findings.title: Unsafe Random Number Generation
findings.description: Cryptographically weak random generator used.

findings.title: Plain Text Private Key in keystore file
findings.description: The private key of a validator was stored in a json file as plain text (used by Tendermint)

findings.title: Build Flow for Release artifacts
findings.description: The build flow for release artifacts may have potential security vulnerabilities or inefficiencies.

findings.title: Configuration Settings
findings.description: There was no documentation describing configuration and settings for Node setup.

findings.title: Deployment
findings.description: There was no production configuration deployment guidelines and instructions.

findings.title: Disassembler Unit Tests
findings.description: There was a lack of unit tests.

findings.title: Plain Text Private Key in keystore file
findings.description: The private key of a validator was stored in a json file as plain text (used by Tendermint)

findings.title: Empty Interfaces
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Incorrect Namespace convention
findings.description: Some classes or interfaces have incorrect namespace that do not correspond to file location.

findings.title: Multisig Verification
findings.description: Transaction signature validation for multisig could be very compute expensive and could be used for DoS attack because transaction is perfectly valid but very computationally heavy.

findings.title: Null Pointer Exceptions (Interop)
findings.description: Unhandled NullPointerException could occur due to some statements. If any exceptions happened by calling AddBlock method, the lastBlock could remained as null causing NullReferenceException in return statement.

findings.title: Random Crash in node initialization
findings.description: **symbol** and **address** with excessively large length values could be used to overwhelm VM resources to cause GC and potential node downtime.

findings.title: Result Of Call To Method Is Ignored
findings.description: Possible null return on result of call to GetChainByName method which could cause unexpected results.

findings.title: Return In Loop
findings.description: Some loop statements had `return` statement.

findings.title: Unreachable Dispose Statement On Exception
findings.description: If any exception occurred during execution of the method, dispose was not called.

findings.title: Incomplete Smart Contracts SDK And Toolchain
findings.description: The protocol's custom Virtual Machine and programming language (TOMB) may have incomplete or outdated SDKs and toolchains, potentially leading to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Block Storage Fuzz Tests
findings.description: Fuzz tests were executed against Block Storage subsystem with various input parameters and methods tested without detecting any issues or crashes.
